HitStopTime.Wiki: Duration of the 'hit' flag on the target.

spEffect0.Wiki: Special effect applied to target on hit

spEffect1.Wiki: Special effect applied to target on hit.

spEffect2.Wiki: Special effect applied to target on hit.

spEffect3.Wiki: Special effect applied to target on hit.

spEffect4.Wiki: Special effect applied to target on hit.

Hit0_DmyPoly1.Wiki: Model point at origin of hitbox if the Hitbox End Model Point is not -1.\nThe hitbox will be a capsule with hemispherical caps positioned at these origins (with a joining cylinder).

Hit1_DmyPoly1.Wiki: Model point at origin of hitbox if the Hitbox End Model Point is not -1.\nThe hitbox will be a capsule with hemispherical caps positioned at these origins (with a joining cylinder).

Hit2_DmyPoly1.Wiki: Model point at origin of hitbox if the Hitbox End Model Point is not -1.\nThe hitbox will be a capsule with hemispherical caps positioned at these origins (with a joining cylinder).

Hit3_DmyPoly1.Wiki: Model point at origin of hitbox if the Hitbox End Model Point is not -1.\nThe hitbox will be a capsule with hemispherical caps positioned at these origins (with a joining cylinder).

Hit0_DmyPoly2.Wiki: Model point at end of capsule hitbox. If this is -1, the hitbox will be a sphere placed at Hitbox Start Model Point.

Hit1_DmyPoly2.Wiki: Model point at end of capsule hitbox. If this is -1, the hitbox will be a sphere placed at Hitbox Start Model Point.

Hit2_DmyPoly2.Wiki: Model point at end of capsule hitbox. If this is -1, the hitbox will be a sphere placed at Hitbox Start Model Point.

Hit3_DmyPoly2.Wiki: Model point at end of capsule hitbox. If this is -1, the hitbox will be a sphere placed at Hitbox Start Model Point.

AtkPhysCorrection.Wiki: Multiplier (as percentage from 0 upwards) applied to character attack power to calculate physical attack damage.

AtkMagCorrection.Wiki: Multiplier (as percentage from 0 upwards) applied to character attack power to calculate magic attack damage.

AtkFireCorrection.Wiki: Multiplier (as percentage from 0 upwards) applied to character attack power to calculate fire attack damage.

AtkThunCorrection.Wiki: Multiplier (as percentage from 0 upwards) applied to character attack power to calculate lightning attack damage.

AtkStamCorrection.Wiki: Multiplier (as percentage from 0 upwards) applied to character attack power to calculate stamina attack damage.

GuardAtkRateCorrection.Wiki: Multiplier (as percentage from 0 upwards) applied to character guard attack power.

GuardBreakCorrection.Wiki: Multiplier (as percentage from 0 upwards) applied to character guard breaking power.

AtkThrowEscapeCorrection.Wiki: Multiplier (as percentage from 0 upwards) applied to weapon attacks during throws.

AtkSuperArmorCorrection.Wiki: Multiplier (as percentage from 0 upwards) applied to damage to target poise.

AtkPhys.Wiki: Absolute physical attack power of attack.

AtkMag.Wiki: Absolute magic attack power of attack.

AtkFire.Wiki: Absolute fire attack power of attack.

AtkThun.Wiki: Absolute lightning attack power of attack.

AtkStam.Wiki: Absolute stamina attack power of attack.

GuardAtkRate.Wiki: Absolute guard attack power of attack.

GuardBreakRate.Wiki: Absolute guard breaking power of attack.

AtkSuperArmor.Wiki: Absolute poise attack power of attack.

AtkThrowEscape.Wiki: Absolute attack power of attack during throw.

AtkObj.Wiki: Amount of damage dealt to objects by this attack.

GuardStaminaCutRate.Wiki: Correction applied to the stamina required to block this attack.

GuardRate.Wiki: Percentage correction made to the guarding ability of the attack, as set in weapon parameters or NPC parameters.

ThrowTypeID.Wiki: Throw to trigger when attack hits. For some reason, throws are triggered using this ID, which is a field within each Throw table entry rather than the ID of the Throw table entry itself.

Hit0_hitType.Wiki: Type of hit applied by hitbox.

Hit1_hitType.Wiki: Type of hit applied by hitbox.

Hit2_hitType.Wiki: Type of hit applied by hitbox.

Hit3_hitType.Wiki: Type of hit applied by hitbox.

hit0_Priority.Wiki: Priority of hitbox. If two hits occur simultaneously, only the highest priority hit occurs.

hit1_Priority.Wiki: Priority of hitbox. If two hits occur simultaneously, only the highest priority hit occurs.

hit2_Priority.Wiki: Priority of hitbox. If two hits occur simultaneously, only the highest priority hit occurs.

hit3_Priority.Wiki: Priority of hitbox. If two hits occur simultaneously, only the highest priority hit occurs.

damageLevel.Wiki: Impact level of attack, which determines how the target reacts to it (e.g. knocked backward, launched into the air, etc.).\nCertain special effects on the target (e.g. Iron Flesh) may re-map this impact level to a different one.

mapHitType.Wiki: Determines how this attack interacts with the map.

GuardCutCancelRate.Wiki: Percentage (from -100 to 100) of target's current guard rate to ignore.\nA value of -100 will ignore guarding completely, and a value of 100 will double their guarding effectiveness.

AtkAttribute.Wiki: Type of physical damage done by attack.

spAttribute.Wiki: Type of elemental damage done by attack.

atkType.Wiki: Determines the sounds and visual effects generated by the attack itself (before hit).

atkMaterial.Wiki: Determines the sounds and visual effects generated when the attack hits. A value of 255 uses the weapon default.

atkSize.Wiki: Size of sounds and visual effects.

DefMaterial.Wiki: Determines the sound effects used when guarding. Usually 255 for Player Attacks and 0 (if not a block) or 50 (if blocking) for Non-Player Attacks.

DefSfxMaterial.Wiki: Determines the visual effects used when guarding. Usually 255 for Player Attacks and 0 (if not a block) or 50 (if blocking) for Non-Player Attacks.

HitSourceType.Wiki: Specify where you get the model point for attack. Set to 1 for parries, ripostes, and basic body attacks (falling, rolling, etc.), and zero otherwise. Use that pattern.

ThrowFlag.Wiki: Determines how this attack relates to throws: not at all, a throw trigger, or a throw damage parameter.

disableGuard.Wiki: If True, this attack cannot be blocked (e.g. throws).

disableStaminaAttack.Wiki: If True, this attack will deal no stamina damage, regardless of its stamina attack power.

disableHitSpEffect.Wiki: If True, this attack will trigger no special effects on the target.

IgnoreNotifyMissSwingForAI.AltName: Disable Missed Attack Notification For AI
IgnoreNotifyMissSwingForAI.Wiki: If True, the character's AI will not be informed when this attack misses. Enabled for basic body attacks (falling, rolling, ladder punches, etc.) that are generally not considered to be serious attacks.

repeatHitSfx.Wiki: If True, sound effects will supposedly be repeated as long as the attack continuously hits a wall.

IsArrowAtk.Wiki: Flags if this is the attack damage parameter of a physical projectile (arrow, bolt, or throwing knife).

IsGhostAtk.Wiki: Flags if this is an attack of a ghost, which presumably disables wall collision, etc.

isDisableNoDamage.Wiki: If True, this attack will ignore invincibility frames from rolling or backstepping (but not other sources of invincibility such as TAE or events).

atkElementCorrectId.Wiki: Override for stat scaling behaviour.\nIf -1, equipped weapon determines AttackElementCorrectParam instead.
